item.title: Stocks Slump Amid Fiscal Cliff Worries
item.description: Stocks were heading lower Monday morning, pulled down by old worries about the debt crisis in Europe and a political standoff over taxes and spending in the U.S.

item.title: Why Black Friday Holiday Sales Matter Less Than Ever Before
item.description: Retailers reported $59.1 billion in sales this Black Friday weekend, up 13% from a year ago. But the jump was smaller than the 16% increase in sales in 2011.

item.title: SEC Head Mary Schapiro to Announce Departure
item.description: Mary L. Schapiro, who overhauled the Securities and Exchange Commission after the financial crisis, is expected to announce on Monday that she is stepping down as chairwoman of the agency.

item.title: Don't Bet Against a Santa Claus Rally
item.description: The only question for traders is whether they missed the entire Santa Claus rally of 2012.

item.title: Why Warren Buffett Is Right About Raising Taxes on the Rich
item.description: The billionaire points out that, even in the 1960s and 1970s, eras with truly high taxes, these taxes did not stop him and his clients from pursuing investment opportunities.

item.title: How Apple Could Fall Below $500
item.description: Another Apple bull has jumped ship. Barry Ritholtz, CEO of Fusion Analytics, has been reducing his clients' positions in Apple since October.

item.title: UnitedHealth Forecasts 2013 Profit Below Wall St. View
item.description: UnitedHealth Group, the largest U.S. private health insurer, said it expects 2013 earnings of $5.25 to $5.50 per share, below analysts' expectations.

item.title: The Dark Side to Record-Breaking Black Friday Sales
item.description: Just in time for those who missed the Black Friday madness today is Cyber Monday.

item.title: McGraw-Hill Selling Education Unit to Apollo for $2.5 Billion
item.description: McGraw-Hill agreed to sell its education unit to Apollo Global Management for $2.5 billion.

item.title: Facebook Upgraded to Outperform at Bernstein
item.description: Analysts at Bernstein Research upgraded shares of Facebook to outperform from market perform.
